comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: This is the Grand Duchess Feodora of Saxony. In 1913 the famous German breeder of roses, Hermann Kiese of Wieselbach (who also edited a rose breeder's magazine), named a new tea rose in her honor, the "Grossherzogin Feodora von Sachsen." Apparently, he named another rose for the Grand Duke, but not until 1915.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks Wystan for identifying Feodora.  Interesting how the names got overlaid on the negative.  We'll add her name to the caption next time we update the record.
